name: mixed natural gas and biomethane production, high pressure | mixed natural gas and biomethane, high pressure | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/23132/documentation

This dataset represents the injection of biomethane (biogas purified to meet the quality requirements to be fed into the natural gas grid) into the natural gas distribution grid. This datasets defines the share of biomethane in the natural gas grid specific to Switzerland (in 2018).;Energy requirements, leakages and losses are accounted for in the respective market datasets for biomethane and natural gas. 

The activity starts with the biomethane ready for injection in the natural gas grid.

The activity ends with a mixture of biomethane and natural gas being available for the consumer.
category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/352:Manufacture of gas; distribution of gaseous fuels through mains/3520:Manufacture of gas; distribution of gaseous fuels through mains

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Share of biomethane in the natural gas grid extracted from statistics for the year 2018.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The share of biomethane in the natural gas grid is specific to Switzerland.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The two mixed products are brought to the quality requirements (e.g. methane content) for grid injection in datasets preceeding this mixing activity.

flow.name: mixed natural gas and biomethane, high pressure
flow.category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/352:Manufacture of gas; distribution of gaseous fuels through mains/3520:Manufacture of gas; distribution of gaseous fuels through mains

exchanges.description:
According to the Swiss Ministry for Energy (BFE), the share of biomethane injected into the natural gas grid is 2% in 2018. This corresponds to an amount of biomethane of 325.1GWh or 3.2E+7m3 in 3.24E9m3 natural gas in 2018.

Reference(s):
BFE 2019, Schweizerische Statistik der erneuerbaren Energien, Ausgabe 2018. Accessed at https://www.bfe.admin.ch/bfe/de/home/versorgung/statistik-und-geodaten/energiestatistiken/teilstatistiken.exturl.html/aHR0cHM6Ly9wdWJkYi5iZmUuYWRtaW4uY2gvZGUvcHVibGljYX/Rpb24vZG93bmxvYWQvOTc2NQ==.html, March 2020.
